articles.headline: As the Crisis Is Revisited, Lawyers Win
articles.snippet: As Bank of America and the insurer MBIA continue to battle over claims left over from the financial crisis, the lawyers are doing well, but those who suffered in the crisis are not.
articles.abstract: As Bank of America and the insurer MBIA continue to battle over claims left over from the financial crisis, the lawyers are doing well, but those who suffered in the crisis are not.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two villains in the financial crisis — whose negligence, or worse, caused untold suffering when the property bubble burst — are fighting it out. They are battling in the courts, and now in the bond market, where lucky owners of one bond issued by a company that may yet go broke are being offered the chance to cash out at par value. Lawyers are cleaning up.The only people who don’t seem to be doing very well are those who are most deserving: the victims of the crisis.

articles.headline: In a Switch, Investors Are Buying European Bank Bonds
articles.snippet: In recent weeks, money managers have been readily buying the new bonds of the region’s financial institutions, deals that just months ago would have seemed unlikely.
articles.abstract: In recent weeks, money managers have been readily buying the new bonds of the region’s financial institutions, deals that just months ago would have seemed unlikely.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — European bank debt, once an investment pariah, is suddenly popular.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Posts Injury Data for 3 Drinks
articles.snippet: Regulatory filings released by the Food and Drug Administration added Rockstar Energy to the group of products possibly involved in health problems.
articles.abstract: Regulatory filings released by the Food and Drug Administration added Rockstar Energy to the group of products possibly involved in health problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: As its policy on highly caffeinated energy drinks is scrutinized, the Food and Drug Administration publicly released records on Thursday about fatality and injury filings that mentioned the possible involvement of three top-selling products.

articles.headline: The New Algorithm of Web Marketing
articles.snippet: Technologies that target ads to specific consumers, rather than aggregate audiences offered by publishers, are punishing newspaper, broadcast and magazine sites.
articles.abstract: Technologies that target ads to specific consumers, rather than aggregate audiences offered by publishers, are punishing newspaper, broadcast and magazine sites.
articles.lead_paragraph: Publishers and broadcasters have long tried to offer advertisers the right audience for their products. Want to sell pick-ups to people who like sports? Buy ads at halftime during a football game. Selling luggage or airline tickets? Buy ads in the travel section of a newspaper or Web site.

articles.headline: Bolder Hamas Tests Alliances in a Shifting Arab World
articles.snippet: In its latest conflict with Israel, Hamas is supported by regional powerhouses and is demonstrating its strength compared with a weak and crisis-laden Palestinian Authority.
articles.abstract: In its latest conflict with Israel, Hamas is supported by regional powerhouses and is demonstrating its strength compared with a weak and crisis-laden Palestinian Authority.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY — Instead of the wedding drums that typically provide the evening soundtrack in this forlorn coastal strip, the black, still air was pierced by gunshots on Thursday, as citizens fired celebratory rounds after the ruling Hamas faction announced that one of its rockets had hit an Israeli aircraft.
articles.byline: By Jodi Rudoren and Fares Akram

articles.headline: In BP Indictments, U.S. Shifts to Hold Individuals Accountable
articles.snippet: The three employees who were indicted in connection with the oil spill are the faces of a renewed effort by the Justice Department to hold executives accountable for their actions.
articles.abstract: The three employees who were indicted in connection with the oil spill are the faces of a renewed effort by the Justice Department to hold executives accountable for their actions.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Donald J. Vidrine and Robert Kaluza were the two BP supervisors on board the Deepwater Horizon rig who made the last critical decisions before it exploded. David Rainey was a celebrated BP deepwater explorer who testified to members of Congress about how many barrels of oil were spewing daily in the offshore disaster.

articles.headline: As Labor Talks Collapse, Hostess Turns Out Lights
articles.snippet: The bankrupt maker of cream-filled pastries like Twinkies and Ho Hos said on Friday that it planned to liquidate, a week after one of the company’s biggest unions went on strike to protest a labor contract.
articles.abstract: The bankrupt maker of cream-filled pastries like Twinkies and Ho Hos said on Friday that it planned to liquidate, a week after one of the company’s biggest unions went on strike to protest a labor contract.
articles.lead_paragraph: What might be the last Twinkie in America — at least for a while — rolled off a factory line Friday morning. It was just like the millions that had come before it, golden, cream-filled empty calories, a monument to classic American junk food.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Steven Greenhouse
